N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 521.4 - Definitions

State Regulations
(a) Applicant. A
local government, voluntary agency, or company which has applied for a State
aid grant, a Facilities Development Corporation mortgage loan or a Housing

Finance Agency mortgage loan pursuant to article 41 and/or article 75 of the

Mental Hygiene Law. (b) Commissioner. The Commissioner of the Office of Mental Health. (c) Community mental health facility. A
program located at a specified site in the community where services for the
mentally ill are provided in accordance with the OMH standards. (d) Company. A community mental health
services company duly incorporated pursuant to the provisions of the

Not-for-Profit Corporation Law and article 75 of the Mental Hygiene Law for the
purpose of providing care, treatment, training, education and/or residential
services for the mentally ill and, such facilities as may be incidental
thereto. (e) Eligible capital costs
for a State aid grant. The actual costs incurred by an applicant for a State
aid grant with respect to site development, architectural/engineering services, site/building acquisition, construction/rehabilitation, original furnishings
and equipment, and other costs of a local facility as defined in article 41 of
the Mental Hygiene Law or as allowed by the Office of Mental Health. Such costs
associated with Housing Finance Agency mortgage loans are referred to as
"project costs" pursuant to article 75 of the Mental Hygiene Law. (f) Eligible capital cost for a housing
finance agency mortgage loan. Capital costs (referred to as "project costs" in
section
75.05
of
the Mental Hygiene Law) eligible for an Housing Finance Agency mortgage loan
may only include costs incurred by the applicant pursuant to article 75 of the

Mental Hygiene Law. (g) Local
government. A county, except a county within the City of New York, and the City
of New York. (h) Local governmental
unit. The unit of local government given authority in accordance with article
41 of the Mental Hygiene Law by local government to provide local or unified
services for the mentally ill. (i) Voluntary agency. A corporation organized or existing pursuant to the

Not-for-Profit Corporation Law and/or article 75 of the Mental Hygiene Law to
provide local or unified services for the mentally ill. Notes
